Name: Estuaire
Description: Estuaire is located in the central coastal region of Gabon and includes the capital city, Libreville. It is the most economically developed province.

Name: Haut-Ogooué
Description: Haut-Ogooué is located in the southeast of Gabon and is known for its mining activities, particularly in manganese and gold.

Name: Moyen-Ogooué
Description: Moyen-Ogooué is a central province known for its lush forests, rivers, and agricultural activities, including cocoa and coffee production.

Name: Ngounié
Description: Ngounié is located in the southern part of Gabon and is known for its diverse wildlife and natural resources, including timber and minerals.

Name: Nyanga
Description: Nyanga is a province in the southwest of Gabon, rich in natural beauty, including beaches, mountains, and rivers.

Name: Ogooué-Ivindo
Description: Ogooué-Ivindo is located in the northeast of Gabon and is known for its rainforests, wildlife, and the Ivindo River. It is also rich in mineral resources.

Name: Ogooué-Lolo
Description: Ogooué-Lolo is located in the southeastern part of Gabon, and its economy is based on agriculture, particularly the production of cacao and rubber.

Name: Woleu-Ntem
Description: Woleu-Ntem is located in the northern part of Gabon, bordering Cameroon and Equatorial Guinea. The province has a diverse mix of natural resources.

Name: Mouila
Description: Mouila is located in the southern part of Gabon and is known for its agricultural activities, including palm oil production and timber.
